byline.contributor: Rick Lyman reported from Budapest, and Alison Smale from Vienna. Boryana Dzhambazova contributed reporting from Montana, Bulgaria, and Joanna Berendt from Warsaw.
byline.original: By RICK LYMAN and ALISON SMALE

abstract: European law enforcement officials say smuggling of migrants into Europe has bloomed into billion-dollar business that is even larger than drug or illegal weapons trades; officials continue to arrest and pursue suspects connected to deaths of 71 migrants who suffocated in sealed truck in Austria.
lead_paragraph: As thousands pour out of Afghanistan and the Middle East, the business of smuggling them into the European Union has grown larger than the illicit trade in drugs and weapons.

headline.main: Migrant Smuggling in Europe Is Now Worth ‘Billions’
headline.print_headline: Smuggling of Migrants Through the Balkans Is Now ‘Worth Billions’

snippet: As thousands pour out of Afghanistan and the Middle East, the business of smuggling them into the European Union has grown larger than the illicit trade in drugs and weapons.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
